snippet: A deal to save the struggling city of Bayonne, N.J., was a good deal for Gov. Chris Christie, but not for the bistate authority.
abstract: Editorial criticizes purchase of waterfront property in Bayonne, NJ, by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey; contends it is an example of what is wrong with way governors of New York and New Jersey have used agency to serve their own political needs; calls on states' legislatures and governors to reform the authority.
lead_paragraph: A deal to save the struggling city of Bayonne, N.J., was a good deal for Gov. Chris Christie, but not for the bistate authority.

headline.seo: Saving Bayonne Was a Good Deal for Chris Christie
headline.main: The Port Authority Is Fooled Again
headline.print_headline: The Port Authority Is Fooled Again

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
